name: ActionLinkDiagnosticInfo

fields.name: actionUrl
fields.description: The action link URL. For example, a Ui action link URL is a Web page. A Download action link URL is a link to the file to download. Ui and Download action link URLs are provided to clients. An Api or ApiAsync action link URL is a REST resource. Api and ApiAsync action link URLs aren’t provided to clients. Links to

fields.name: createdDate
fields.description: An ISO 8601 format date string, for example,

fields.name: excludedUserId
fields.description: ID of a single user to exclude from

fields.name: headers
fields.description: The request headers for the Api and ApiAsync action link

fields.name: id
fields.description: The 18-character ID for the action link definition.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A custom label to display on the action link button. A

fields.name: labelKey
fields.description: Key for the set of labels to show in the user

fields.name: method
fields.description: The HTTP method. One of these values:

fields.name: modifiedDate
fields.description: An ISO 8601 format date string, for example,

fields.name: requestBody
fields.description: The request body for Api and ApiAsync action link

fields.name: templateId
fields.description: The ID of the action link template from which to instantiate this action

fields.name: type
fields.description: Defines the type of action link. Values are:

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The ID of the user who can execute the action.

description: The definition of an action link.  Action link definition can be sensitive to a third party (for example, OAuth bearer token headers). For this reason, only calls made from the Apex namespace that created the action link definition can read, modify, or delete the definition. In addition, the user making the call must have created the definition or have View All Data permission.
